Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a light-brown pottery vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse and red/grey in section, the interior is slightly grooved, the exterior is covered with a light-brown slip, with two lines of cord-marked decoration and very faint traces of the remains of one line of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393370) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393370)
